title: 107_s1254
content: The "Mark-to-Market Extension Act of 2001" is the short title of this Act, with the purpose outlined in Section 2. The purposes of this Act are to continue the progress of the Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997, ensure properties undergoing mortgage restructurings are rehabilitated to meet long-term affordability requirements, set reserves at adequate levels, operate properties efficiently, and maintain long-term financial and physical integrity. To ensure the financial and physical integrity of properties undergoing rent restructurings, maintain adequate resources for property upkeep, focus on eligible properties for restructuring, track property conditions regularly, support tenant organizations, and encourage continued assistance restructuring efforts. Assistance restructuring allows administrative entities to address specific problems while ensuring consistent outcomes nationwide. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to define the terms 'Department' and 'Office'. Additionally, FHA-insured multifamily housing mortgage and housing assistance restructuring is addressed. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to require the Secretary to provide assistance for tenant services and groups, nonprofit organizations, and public entities. Additionally, the Act addresses rents and mortgages under this subtitle and specifies that assistance accepted by the owner must be used for rent if the property remains as rental housing. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to require the Secretary to provide assistance for tenant services, nonprofit organizations, and public entities. The Act also addresses mortgage restructuring and rental assistance plans for property sales or transfers under this subtitle. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to require the Secretary to provide assistance for tenant services, nonprofit organizations, and public entities. This includes plans for property sales or transfers under approved housing preservation acts, with requirements for adding significant features like air conditioning or elevators. The Secretary established guidelines for rehabilitation assistance in multifamily housing projects, limiting owner contribution to 25%. This applies to all projects except those with a pre-existing mortgage restructuring plan. Owners are still required to contribute to rehabilitation costs as per paragraph (7)(B). The Secretary established guidelines for rehabilitation assistance in multifamily housing projects, limiting owner contribution to 25%. Owners must contribute to rehabilitation costs as required under paragraph (7)(B). Section 512(2) is amended to set limits on rents exceeding those of comparable properties in the same market area. The section discusses the renewal of project-based assistance under a specific subtitle, along with requirements for reporting on the physical and financial condition of properties undergoing rent and mortgage restructurings. It also emphasizes oversight by the Department in monitoring these properties. The section addresses the renewal of project-based assistance and reporting requirements for the financial and physical condition of properties undergoing rent and mortgage restructurings. It also highlights oversight by the Department in monitoring these properties. SEC. 5 amends the United States Housing Act of 1937 to include enhanced vouchers with rent limitations. SEC. 6 addresses miscellaneous housing insurance. Section 223(a)(7) of the National Housing Act is amended to include provisions for existing mortgages held by the Secretary subject to a mortgage restructuring and rental assistance sufficiency plan. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 allows refinanced mortgages to have a term of up to 30 years. SEC. 7. TECHNICAL CORRECTION. Amends Section 531(c) of Public Law 106-74 by changing a reference. Retroactive effect applies. SEC. 8. OFFICE OF MULTIFAMILY HOUSING ASSISTANCE RESTRUCTURING. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to include changes in sections 571, 572, 573, and 579. The Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 is amended to repeal certain sections and limit subsequent employment. Section 576 is amended to reduce the period from 2 years to 1 year, and section 578 is repealed. Section 576 is amended to reduce the period from 2 years to 1 year, and section 578 is repealed. GAO REPORTS. The Comptroller General of the United States must submit an annual report to Congress on the activities under the Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997. The report should detail progress in restructuring multifamily housing projects and address any concerns or shortcomings. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a final report to Congress on the termination of the restructuring program for multifamily housing projects under the Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997. The report will detail matters related to the termination of the Office of Multifamily Housing Assistance Restructuring. The termination of the restructuring program for multifamily housing projects under the Multifamily Assisted Housing Reform and Affordability Act of 1997 will result in the transition of remaining responsibilities to the Office of Housing within the Department of Housing and Urban Development.
